This Valentine's Day was the absolute BEST Valentine's Day EVER! As everyone knows, me and my bf have been having alotta problems recently w/ trust issues and juss stupid fights over ridiculous things. Well, yesterday he really made up for it. I was upset b/c I worked from 10-3 and I didnt get a call from him besides the call at midnight wishing me a happy valentine's day and a happy anniversary. (yesterday was also our 11 month anniversary) Well he surprised me and showed up at my house around 3:30. He bought me the most beautiful roses I have ever seen (peach w/ pink on top). He also spent an hour and a half cooking me dinner (flounder and shrimp). We had a candlelight dinner and then he had candy hearts leading up to the bathroom where he had a bubble bath w/ rose pedals waiting for me. ;) You can guess what happened after that, no need for detail...lol Overall, it was prolly one of the best days of our entire 11 month relationship. We talked and basically patched things up between us and settled all the little problems in our relationship. We're now working on getting along better and juss enjoying being happy with each other. I hope everyone had as great a Valentine's Day as I did! I gotta go eat dinner then work on a history report! Cya! <33 :)

This past week has been really rough on me. As most of you know, my good friend and ex-boyfriend passed away on Saturday, Jan. 10, 2004. He was my first love and I was his. We were together for a year and had COUNTLESS memories together. After a week of grieving over him and visiting him while on life support in the hospital, I have finally found my peace with his passing away. 

I bought myself a cross necklace with my birthstone in it and I also bought Bill the same necklace with his birthstone in it. I put it in a bag along with a note and a sympathy card, and I left it on the porch at his house for his mom to receive. 

Today, I attended Bill's viewing from 2-4. Bill looked absolutely gorgeous. They dressed him in a red South Pole sweater and jeans. He wouldn't have wanted to wear a suit, everyone knows that. 

But, the BEST part was that the necklace I had bought him was enclosed in his folded hands. =*[

His mother broke out into tears at the sight of me entering. She endlessly thanked me for the necklace and praised my thoughtful gesture. She said it made her day and she was so happy and actually smiled. She also ended with "He loved you so much." His sister also told me the same thing, "He loved you." 

Because of this, I feel soo good about what I had done. It feels so good to know that even in this time of grief, I brought a smile to his mother's face, even for a brief second. Bill has something from me to carry on with him in heaven. In this, I have found my inner peace. <'33
http://babyydawl.livejournal.com/4990.html

First and foremost, I want to say:

REST IN PEACE WILLIAM (BILL) MICHAEL MEDEIROS <'33

<'33 An Angel Born on March 22, 1983 <'33

<'33 Sadly Passed Away on January 10, 2004 <'33

Bill truly was an angel within his short time here on Earth. He brought life and laughter to his friends and family. He had a huge heart and cared so deeply for the people in his life. He was a great friend and was so fun to be with. He had many friends and a large family who he loved and cared about dearly. Sadly, a few of these friends were not as true to him as he thought and got him involved in things which tragically lead to his death. If a certain individual would've used his brain and heart in making a quick decision, a lot of pain and heartache could've been prevented. Sadly, Bill did make a deadly choice, but another individual made an even deadlier choice. Now, his family and friends are left here on Earth to grieve over this angel. We have only the memory of his gorgeous face and bright smile looking down upon us. Everyone wishes that fate did not take this turn, but unfortunately it did. No one and nothing can bring him back. It's sad and heartbreaking. We must cherish the time he was with us and the memories we do have with him. He truly is an angel and will remain in our hearts and prayers forever, until our dying day. He's in heaven now among other angels and God is looking after him now. GOD BLESS YOU Bill. You are sadly missed by all. <'33
